skill.name: test-generator
skill.description: Generate unit tests based on existing code patterns and testing frameworks.
skill.summary: Generate unit tests based on existing code patterns and testing frameworks.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill that generates test code. It has no executable code, network access, file system access, or environment variable access. The skill only provides instructions for analyzing code and generating tests.

content.value_statement: Writing comprehensive unit tests is time-consuming and often incomplete. This skill analyzes your code and generates complete test suites with edge cases, error handling, and proper mocking.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes existing code patterns and function signatures
Detects testing framework (Jest, pytest, JUnit, etc.)
Generates comprehensive test cases with edge cases
limitations: Cannot run tests - only generates code
May need manual adjustment for complex logic

use_cases.title: Legacy Code Test Coverage
use_cases.description: Add tests to untested legacy codebases to improve reliability and enable refactoring

use_cases.title: New Feature Testing
use_cases.description: Generate initial test suites for new features following team conventions

use_cases.title: Contribution Requirements
use_cases.description: Create tests required for pull requests in projects with strict testing policies

prompt_templates.title: Basic Test Generation
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate tests for a simple function

prompt_templates.title: Watch Mode
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate tests in watch mode for TDD

prompt_templates.title: Complex Module
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate tests for a module with dependencies

output: - Edge case tests (null, undefined, empty strings)

best_practices: Review generated tests to ensure they match your testing philosophy
Add custom edge cases specific to your domain
Use the generated tests as a starting point, not the final version
anti_patterns: Blindly committing generated tests without review
Using generated tests as a substitute for thinking about test design
Generating tests for code that should be refactored first

faq.question: Which testing frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Jest, Mocha, Vitest, pytest, unittest, Go testing, JUnit, TestNG, RSpec, and Minitest

faq.question: Can it generate integration tests?
faq.answer: Yes, it can generate integration tests where appropriate, following your project's patterns

faq.question: How does it handle external dependencies?
faq.answer: It automatically creates mocks for external dependencies like APIs, databases, and file systems

faq.question: Will it overwrite existing tests?
faq.answer: No, it preserves existing tests and only adds new ones for untested code

faq.question: Can I customize the test generation?
faq.answer: Yes, use flags like --coverage or --watch to control generation behavior

faq.question: Is the generated code production-ready?
faq.answer: The code follows best practices but always review and adjust for your specific needs
